Title: Server crashes if max_connections decreased below certain level
Description: If max_connections variable is set to a value less than the number of currently open connections, the server crashes soon afterwards.
Root Cause: Improperly handle updated values

Title: buf_pool_is_obsolete is not thread safe
Description: innodb_buffer_pool_sizeIf is shrinked just between buf_pool_is_obsolete and btr_cur_optimistic_latch_leaves. The invalid block pointer would be accessed,  then cause cause bad result.
Root Cause: Bad update timing

Title: Stress test: Server crashes on regular query_cache_notembedded
Description: set GLOBAL query_cache_size=1355776 in query_cache_notembedded test case, the system crash
Root Cause: Bad update timing

Title: set global query_cache_size can crash the server under high load
Description: set global query_cache_size can crash the server
Root Cause: Bad update timing

Title: ndb_log_apply_status can be changed online, even though it is not dynamic
Description: Despite the fact that it is possible to change the value of this variable on a running MySQL server using SET GLOBAL, the behavior of the server with respect to this variable is not altered.
Root Cause: Fail to consider loading updated values

Title: Setting variables for Audit plugin does not work
Description: audit_log_exclude_accounts can be edited but is not changed in the server although it is a dynamic variable.
Root Cause: Fail to consider loading updated values

Title: Problems with thread_handling system variable
Description: set GLOBAL thread_handling, didn't change its value
Root Cause: Fail to consider loading updated values

Title: Problem setting falcon_record_chill_threshold and falcon_index_chill_threshold
Description: using SET GLOBAL on them does not result in the new values being visible in SHOW VARIABLES.
Root Cause: Fail to consider loading updated values

Title: ndb_cache_check_time doesn't get set from my.cnf file
Description: when set ndb_cache_check_time in my.cnf, it does not set the variable. If set the variable manually using set global ndb_cache_check_time, it works just fine.
Root Cause: Fail to consider loading updated values

Title: Impossible high query cache setting resets cache size to 0 bytes
Description: Setting the query cache size to high will resize the cache to 0.
Root Cause: Load wrong updated values

Title: Replication: set global server_id is not setting the session server_id
Description: setting the  global server_id is not setting the session server_id which cause changed to follow to record the old sever id.
Root Cause: Miss to propagate to other variables

Title: log_queries_not_using_indexes variable dynamic change is ignored
Description: log_queries_not_using_indexes system variable is dynamic and can be changed with SET GLOBAL. The value can be really changed, but it does not change server behaviour.
Root Cause: Miss to propagate to other variables

Title: log-queries-not-using-indexes runtime changes don't affect logging
Description: log-queries-not-using-indexes listed as dynamic variable, but runtime changes of its value don't affect logging.
Root Cause: Miss to propagate to other variables

Title: Setting server_id on fly doesn't allow replication to start
Description: setting the server_id variable on the fly, didn't take effect
Root Cause: Miss to propagate to other variables

Title: read_buffer_size is only partially dynamic variable
Description: my_default_record_cache_size is not updated after read_buffer_size is updated on the fly
Root Cause: Miss to propagate to other variables

Title: INSERT DELAYED does not honour SQL_MODE of the client
Description: updating SQL_MODE didn't take effect
Root Cause: Miss to propagate to other variables

Title: INSERT DELAYED does not honour auto_increment_* variables
Description: updating auto_increment_* didn't take effect
Root Cause: Miss to propagate to other variables

Title: If binlog format is changed between update and unlock of tables, wrong binlog
Description: updating binlog_format didn't take effect. the master's binlog will contain a table map event but no rows event, so slave will not be able to repeat the insertion.
Root Cause: Fail to consider handling updated values

Title: SET GROUP_CONCAT_MAX_LEN doesn't flush query cache
Description: updating GROUP_CONCAT_MAX_LEN didn't take effect
Root Cause: Fail to consider handling updated values

Title: max_sort_length does not invalidate queries in the query cache
Description: updating max_sort_length didn't take effect
Root Cause: Fail to consider handling updated values

Title: InnoDB miscalculates auto-increment after changing auto_increment_increment
Description: updating auto_increment_increment on the fly, but get wrong result
Root Cause: Improperly handle updated values
